intro: Bupariti rogersii, commonly known as the Rogers' bupariti, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from pale yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical and have a slightly hairy texture. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Bupariti rogersii is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
